results.title: The Single Parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
P.G.R. starts this topic by talking with a group of people about how they became single parents, and how they coped during the early stages. We then examine the problems of being a single parent, including household and financial management, helping children through this difficult period of their lives, and sharing the responsibility for the care of the kids. Finally, our guests reflect on their experiences, discussing the hardships and what they have gained as single parents.

results.title: Change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Children can be disoriented by change, and here we discuss this process. Parents describe the effects on their children of moving house, changing childcare centres, and emergency admissions into hospital. We discuss behaviour patterns which may indicate change is disturbing to a child. Two families talk about the deaths, one expected, the other sudden, of younger children. Finally we discuss ways of dealing with change.

results.title: Run Rebecca, run!
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: While on a photographic expedition Rebecca Porter finds herself on Lonesome Island where she meets Manuel, a South American ship’s deserter who missed the recently announced amnesty and who is now in fear of arrest and deportation. Manuel tries to stop Rebecca leaving the Island until the Police have stopped looking for him but Rebecca has other plans. Starring Henri Szeps, John Stanton, Mary Ann Severne, Adam Garnett and Simone Buchanan. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Salome
results.creator_credit: Gotz Friedrich, Horant H. Hohlfeld and Unitel
results.brief_description: Translated into German by Hedwig Lachmann, and featuring the music of Richard Strauss by the Weiner Philharmoniker conducted by Kar Bohn, this adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s play is true to the story and emotions of the original. It is based on biblical characters and carries a strong moral message. It is the story of King Herod Antipas of Judea (Hans Beirer), son of Herod the Great, who is living in unlawful union with Herodias (Astrid Varnay), the wife of his brother whom he caused to be murdered. Already tired of her, he lusts after Salome (Teresa Stratas), the daughter of Herodias by her first marriage. John the Baptist (Bernd Weikl), herald of a new era who has a great following among the people, has foretold the coming of a New Kingdom, and punishment for all sinners - focussing on the debauched life of Herod and his Court. Salome is obsessed with the prophet and upon being rebutted by him she uses her feminine wiles to ask for his head on a plate. The King acquiesces to her request and the prophet’s death signals the beginning of the downfall of a once great kingdom!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gotz Friedrich, Horant H. Hohlfeld and Unitel
